meanings.definition: A narrow-edged tooth at the front of the mouth, adapted for cutting.
meanings.sent1: Her incisors helped her bite into the juicy apple.
meanings.sent2: The dentist examined her incisors to check for cavities.
meanings.sent3: The incisors in the puppy's mouth made him look adorable when he tried to chew on a toy.
meanings.sent4: His incisors were like tiny knives, effortlessly slicing through the tough steak.
meanings.sent5: The rabbit's incisors never stopped growing, so it constantly gnawed on things to keep them short.

meanings.definition: A tooth with a sharp edge for cutting food.
meanings.sent1: The incisors of the predator were perfect for tearing into its prey.
meanings.sent2: She used her incisors to neatly slice through the sandwich.
meanings.sent3: The incisors of the squirrel made quick work of cracking open the nut.
meanings.sent4: His incisors were so sharp, they could effortlessly pierce through the tough skin of the fruit.
meanings.sent5: The beaver's incisors were strong enough to gnaw through thick tree branches with ease.
